---

## SURVIVING SPOUSE AND DEPENDENT BENEFITS RESEARCH (2026)

### 1. DEPENDENCY AND INDEMNITY COMPENSATION (DIC)

**What It Is**
Dependency and Indemnity Compensation is a monthly benefit paid to surviving spouses and children of Veterans who died from a service-connected disability or while on active duty.

**2026 Rates (Effective December 1, 2025)**
- **Surviving Spouse (base):** $1,699.36/month
- **Eight-Year Provision Supplement:** $360.85/month (if Veteran had 100% disability rating for 8+ years before death and spouse was married during that period)
- **Aid and Attendance Supplement:** $421.00/month (for those needing assistance with daily activities)
- **Housebound Allowance:** $197.22/month (for those unable to leave home due to disability)
- **Per Child Under 18:** $421.00/month per child
- **Transitional Benefit:** $359.00/month for first 2 years after Veteran's death (for spouses with dependent children)

**Eligibility Requirements - Surviving Spouses**
- Lived with the Veteran/service member continuously until death (or weren't at fault for separation)
- Married within 15 years of discharge, OR married for at least 1 year, OR had a child with the Veteran
- The Veteran must have died:
  - While on active duty, OR
  - From a service-connected illness or injury

**Eligibility - Surviving Children**
- Unmarried, under 18 (or under 23 if attending school)
- Not receiving compensation through another survivor

**How to Apply**
- Online through AccessVA QuickSubmit
- Mail VA Form 21P-534EZ or 21P-535EZ to Pension Intake Center, Janesville, WI
- In-person at VA regional office
- With an accredited representative or Veterans Service Organization

**Important Notes**
- DIC benefits are tax-exempt
- Rates vary based on Veteran's military pay grade if death occurred before January 1, 1993

**Website:** [VA.gov DIC Benefits](https://www.va.gov/family-and-caregiver-benefits/survivor-compensation/dependency-indemnity-compensation/)

---

### 2. SURVIVORS PENSION

**What It Is**
An income-based monthly pension for surviving spouses and dependent children of wartime Veterans with limited income and net worth.

**2026 Rates and Limits (Effective December 1, 2025 - November 30, 2026)**

**Maximum Annual Pension Rate (MAPR):**
- Surviving spouse (no dependents): $11,699/year ($974/month)
- Surviving spouse with 1 dependent child: $15,311/year ($1,276/month)
- Surviving spouse with Housebound: $14,298/year - $17,902/year
- Surviving spouse with Aid and Attendance: $18,697/year - $22,304/year
- Per qualifying dependent child: $2,984/year

**Net Worth Limit:** $163,699 (December 1, 2025 - November 30, 2026)

**Income Calculation**
Your benefit is based on the difference between your income for VA purposes and the MAPR limit. Excluded from income:
- Medical expenses exceeding 5% of MAPR
- Dependent children's wages up to $16,100 annually

**Eligibility Requirements - Surviving Spouses**
- Haven't remarried after Veteran's death (may requalify if remarriage ends)
- Veteran served during recognized wartime period:
  - Mexican Border (1916-1917)
  - World War I, II
  - Korean Conflict
  - Vietnam War era
  - Gulf War (ongoing)
- Veteran met service length requirements:
  - Pre-1980 entry: 90 days active duty
  - Post-1980 entry: 24 months active duty
- Family income and net worth below Congressional limits

**Eligibility - Dependent Children**
- Unmarried, under 18 (under 23 while attending VA-approved school, or permanently disabled before age 18)

**How to Apply**
- Online through AccessVA QuickSubmit
- Mail VA Form 21P-534EZ to Pension Intake Center, Janesville, WI
- In-person at VA regional office
- With accredited representative or VSO
- File "intent to file" to preserve earlier effective date for retroactive payments

**Website:** [VA.gov Survivors Pension](https://www.va.gov/family-and-caregiver-benefits/survivor-compensation/survivors-pension/)

---

### 3. CHAMPVA (CIVILIAN HEALTH AND MEDICAL PROGRAM OF THE VA)

**What It Is**
A cost-sharing health insurance program where VA shares costs of medically necessary healthcare services and supplies for eligible family members.

**Eligibility**
- Surviving spouses and dependent children of Veterans who:
  - Died from a service-connected disability, OR
  - Were permanently and totally disabled from a service-connected disability at time of death
- Service member who died in line of duty (not due to misconduct)

**Remarriage Rules**
- Surviving spouses who remarry on or after age 55 can retain CHAMPVA benefits
- Those remarrying before age 55 lose eligibility (but may requalify if remarriage ends)

**Coverage Includes**
- Inpatient and outpatient services
- Mental health services
- Prescription medications
- Transplants
- Ambulatory surgery
- Family planning and maternity care
- Other medically necessary healthcare

**How to Enroll**
- Online application portal
- Mail VA Form 10-10d to Spring City, PA address
- Fax VA Form 10-10d (contact number on form)
- Required documents: marriage certificate, birth certificates (for children), health insurance information

**Contact**
- Phone: Monday-Friday, 8 a.m. to 7:30 p.m. ET
- Mail inquiries to Spring City, PA address

**2026 Update**
- VA will no longer automatically mail 1095-B tax documentation forms

**Website:** [VA.gov CHAMPVA](https://www.va.gov/family-and-caregiver-benefits/health-and-disability/champva/)

---

### 4. EDUCATION BENEFITS FOR DEPENDENTS

#### A. Survivors' and Dependents' Educational Assistance (DEA) - Chapter 35

**What It Is**
Education and training benefits for children and spouses of Veterans who are permanently and totally disabled or deceased from service-connected causes.

**Eligibility**
- **Children:** Age 18+ (or completed high school/GED), able to use benefits up to 8 years before turning 26
- **Spouses:** Can receive DEA and DIC simultaneously
- Veteran must be:
  - Permanently and totally disabled from service-connected disability, OR
  - Deceased from service-connected causes, OR
  - Died on active duty, OR
  - Missing/captured for 90+ days

**2026 Monthly Rates (October 1, 2025 - September 30, 2026)**

**Institutions of Higher Learning:**
- Full-time: $1,574.00/month
- 3/4-time: $1,244.00/month
- 1/2-time: $912.00/month
- Less than 1/2-time, more than 1/4-time: $912.00/month (or tuition, whichever is less)
- 1/4-time or less: $393.50/month (or tuition, whichever is less)

**On-the-Job Training & Apprenticeships:**
- Months 1-6: $999.00/month
- Months 7-12: $751.00/month
- Months 13-18: $493.00/month
- 19+ months: $251.00/month

**Other Programs:**
- Special restorative training (full-time): $1,574.00/month
- Licensing/certification test fees: Up to $2,000
- Correspondence training: 55% of established costs

**Benefit Duration**
- Up to 45 months (if training started before August 1, 2018)
- Up to 36 months (if training started on or after August 1, 2018)

**What's Covered**
- Undergraduate/graduate degrees
- Vocational training
- Apprenticeships
- Online learning

**How to Apply**
- Online application
- Mail VA Form 22-5490 to regional processing office
- Notify school's certifying official after applying
- Must verify enrollment monthly to receive payments

**Website:** [VA.gov DEA](https://www.va.gov/family-and-caregiver-benefits/education-and-careers/dependents-education-assistance/)

---

#### B. Fry Scholarship (Marine Gunnery Sergeant John David Fry Scholarship)

**What It Is**
Education benefits for dependents of service members who died on or after September 11, 2001.

**Eligibility**
- **Children & Spouses:** Service member or Selected Reserve member who:
  - Died in line of duty while on active duty, OR
  - Died from service-connected disability within 120 days of discharge, OR
  - Died in line of duty (Selected Reserve only)
- Children must be at least 18 or have high school diploma/GED
- Surviving spouses: remarriage doesn't affect eligibility; can receive DIC simultaneously

**Benefits (Up to 36 months)**
- Tuition and fees
- Housing allowance
- Books and supplies
- Tutorial assistance
- Licensing/certification tests
- Work-study opportunities

**Time Limits**
- Service member deaths before January 1, 2013: benefits expire at age 33 (with exceptions)
- Deaths on/after January 1, 2013: no time limit
- Selected Reserve members: no time limit

**How to Apply**
- Online application
- Mail VA Form 22-5490 to regional processing office
- Notify school's certifying official after applying
- Use GI Bill Comparison Tool to find approved schools

**Website:** [VA.gov Fry Scholarship](https://www.va.gov/family-and-caregiver-benefits/education-and-careers/fry-scholarship/)

---

#### C. GI Bill Transfer to Dependents

**What It Is**
Option for Veterans to transfer unused GI Bill educational benefits to eligible family members (spouses and children).

**Important Note**
- You cannot use both DEA and Fry Scholarship—must choose one
- If service member died in line of duty before August 1, 2011, can use both programs but only one at a time (combined benefits capped at 81 months)

**Website:** [VA.gov Education and Careers](https://www.va.gov/family-and-caregiver-benefits/education-and-careers/)

---

### 5. BURIAL BENEFITS

**What It Is**
VA-provided burial benefits for eligible spouses and dependents in VA national cemeteries.

**Eligibility**
- Surviving spouses of Veterans (eligible regardless of remarriage)
- Dependent children and other family members

**2026 Burial Allowances (for deaths on/after October 1, 2025)**
- Burial allowance: $1,002
- Plot allowance: $1,002
- Total: $2,004

**What's Included at National Cemetery**
- Burial at VA national cemetery (no cost to family)
- Perpetual care of grave
- Headstone or marker inscription with name, dates of birth and death (no cost)
- Eligible spouses and dependents may be buried even if they predecease the Veteran
- May be buried in same gravesite as Veteran

**How to Apply**
- VA automatically pays burial allowance after receiving notice of Veteran's death
- No filing required by surviving spouse for burial allowance
- Contact VA to arrange burial at national cemetery

**Contact**
- VA benefits hotline: 800-827-1000 (TTY: 711)

**Website:** [VA.gov Burial and Memorials](https://www.va.gov/family-and-caregiver-benefits/burials-and-memorials/)

---

### 6. HOUSING BENEFITS FOR SURVIVING SPOUSES

#### A. VA Home Loans

**What It Is**
VA-backed home loans available to surviving spouses for purchase, construction, improvement, or refinance of homes.

**Eligibility**
- Surviving spouse of Veteran who died from service-connected disability
- Certificate of Eligibility (COE) required

**Key Features**
- No down payment typically required
- VA guarantees portion of loan to lender
- Competitive interest rates
- No prepayment penalties

**How to Apply**
- Request Certificate of Eligibility (COE)
- Apply through VA housing assistance portal
- Calculate remaining entitlement based on county loan limits
- Work with VA-approved lenders

**Website:** [VA.gov Housing Assistance](https://www.va.gov/family-and-caregiver-benefits/housing-assistance/)

---

#### B. Foreclosure Prevention

**What It Is**
Resources to help surviving spouses avoid foreclosure and keep homes when facing mortgage payment difficulties.

**How to Access**
- Contact VA housing assistance office
- Visit official VA website for resources

**Website:** [VA.gov Housing Assistance](https://www.va.gov/family-and-caregiver-benefits/housing-assistance/)

---

#### C. Gold Star Family Housing Programs (Non-VA)

**Tunnel to Towers Foundation - Gold Star Family Home Program**
- Provides mortgage-free homes to surviving spouses with young children
- Honors those who made ultimate sacrifice
- Program launched September 2018

**Operation Finally Home**
- Awards 100% mortgage-free homes to Gold Star spouses
- Includes 3 years of family and financial mentoring
- Additional support services included

**State Benefits**
- Many states offer additional benefits for Gold Star Families including:
  - Tuition waivers
  - Property tax relief
  - Other state-specific assistance

**Websites:**
- [Tunnel to Towers Gold Star Program](https://t2t.org/gold-star/)
- [Operation Finally Home](https://www.operationwearehere.com/)
- [Gold Star Family Resources](https://www.goldstarfamilyresources.com/)

---

## SUMMARY TABLE: Quick Reference

| Benefit | Type | 2026 Benefit Amount | Website |
|---------|------|-------------------|---------|
| **DIC** | Monthly stipend | $1,699.36+ (spouse base) | [VA DIC](https://www.va.gov/family-and-caregiver-benefits/survivor-compensation/dependency-indemnity-compensation/) |
| **Survivors Pension** | Monthly (income-based) | $974-$1,276/mo (spouse range) | [VA Pension](https://www.va.gov/family-and-caregiver-benefits/survivor-compensation/survivors-pension/) |
| **CHAMPVA** | Healthcare | Cost-sharing program | [VA CHAMPVA](https://www.va.gov/family-and-caregiver-benefits/health-and-disability/champva/) |
| **DEA** | Monthly education | $393-$1,574/mo (varies by enrollment) | [VA DEA](https://www.va.gov/family-and-caregiver-benefits/education-and-careers/dependents-education-assistance/) |
| **Fry Scholarship** | Monthly education | Up to 36 months benefits | [VA Fry](https://www.va.gov/family-and-caregiver-benefits/education-and-careers/fry-scholarship/) |
| **Burial** | One-time | $1,002 burial + $1,002 plot | [VA Burial](https://www.va.gov/family-and-caregiver-benefits/burials-and-memorials/) |
| **VA Home Loan** | Housing | No down payment (typically) | [VA Housing](https://www.va.gov/family-and-caregiver-benefits/housing-assistance/) |
| **Gold Star Homes** | Housing (nonprofit) | Mortgage-free homes | [Tunnel to Towers](https://t2t.org/gold-star/) |
